intro: Fritillaria shikokiana f. yamadae, commonly known as the Yamada's fritillary, is a rare and striking bulbous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, often orange or reddish flowers. The plant produces narrow, linear leaves and has a distinctive, elongated bulb that stores nutrients for growth. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
